title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 §§ 271-7.16 - Ventilation-general
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 §§ 271-7.16 - Ventilation-general

State Regulations

All rooms shall have sufficient ventilation to keep them
free of excessive heat, steam, condensation, vapors, obnoxious odors, smoke and
fumes. Ventilation systems shall be installed and operated according to law
and, when vented to the outside, shall not create a harmful or unlawful
discharge. Intake and exhaust air ducts shall be maintained to prevent the
entrance of dust, dirt and other contaminating materials. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
§§
271-7.16

Repealed

New

York State Register June 22, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 25, eff. 6/22/2016

Adopted

New

York State Register December 21, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 51, eff. 12/21/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
